description: From centēsimāt-, the perfect passive participial stem of the Latin centēsimō, from centēsimus (“hundredth”); compare tertiate, quintate, sextate, septimate, decimate, and duodecimate.

verbs.description: centesimate (third-person singular simple present centesimates, present participle centesimating, simple past and past participle centesimated)

entries.meaning: To select one person in every hundred for a punishment
